articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as Australia play the Netherlands in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: Australia v Netherlands - clips, radio & text

articles.description: Wales and British and Irish Lions great Leigh Halfpenny announces he will retire from international rugby.
articles.title: Wales great Halfpenny to retire from Test rugby

articles.description: Arsenal and Manchester United win in the Champions League, while emotional tributes are paid to Sir Bobby Charlton and Everton chairman Bill Kenwright.
articles.title: Champions League reaction after wins for Arsenal & Man Utd

articles.description: From video games to uniting a nation, Rassie Erasmus constantly finds new ways to drill and motivate a South Africa team targeting back-to-back Rugby World Cup triumphs.
articles.title: Disco lights and dark arts - meet South Africa's 'scientist of rugby'

articles.description: BBC Sport profiles Barcelona and Spain midfielder Aitana Bonmati, one of five nominees for the BBC Women's Footballer of the Year 2023 award.
articles.title: Is Bonmati your Women's Footballer of the Year?

articles.description: BBC Sport visits Tyneside to explore how Newcastle United have gone from relegation candidates to a Champions League club since being taken over in 2021.
articles.title: 'The whole city is buzzing' - Is Newcastle's rise unstoppable?

articles.description: Andre Onana and Harry Maguire overcome recent criticism to help Manchester United secure their first Champions League win of the season against Copenhagen.
articles.title: Unlikely heroes Maguire and Onana step up for Man Utd

articles.description: A new British-focused women’s cycling team has big ambitions, but can it find the success to match its money?
articles.title: Can this new British squad take women's cycling by storm?

articles.description: BBC chief football writer Phil McNulty explains how Everton was one of the great loves of theatre impresario Bill Kenwright's life.
articles.title: 'Sporting love story with unhappy ending' - Kenwright and Everton

articles.description: The 2027 Rugby World Cup will be a "more compact" tournament which will lead to "more interest and bigger audiences", says World Rugby boss Alan Gilpin.
articles.title: 2027 Rugby World Cup will be more compact - Gilpin
